intro: Hieracium caniceps, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it blooms from June to August. Hieracium caniceps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
